text:
Hi everyone,
I have implemented this library some time ago. <https://github.com/Agent-Hellboy/FileType.jl>.
 I am a beginner at Julia with very minimal experience. I want to publish this package to Julia's registry but I am not doing this as I
think, I am not experienced enough to publish a package that can be consumed by others. I am looking forward to a pull request with good
docstrings, best coding practices and other bug fixes which i am not aware of, so that I could publish this.

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

This overall looks like a well-written and interesting package!

It's written in a very python-y way, where every file is it's own module. Often Julia packages are written as just one big module, because it can get confusing to deal with all the different namespaces.
